meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a dull sound.
meanings.sent1: He dunched the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: She dunches the dough to make it flat before baking.
meanings.sent3: The chef dunched the garlic cloves to release their flavor into the dish.
meanings.sent4: The drummer dunches the drumsticks against the drum in rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter dunches the chisel into the stone to carve intricate designs.

meanings.definition: A dull, heavy blow or sound.
meanings.sent1: The dunch of the hammer echoed through the workshop.
meanings.sent2: The tree fell with a loud dunch as it hit the ground.
meanings.sent3: The dunch of the falling book startled the cat from its nap.
meanings.sent4: The heavy dunch of the door closing signaled the end of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The distant dunch of thunder warned of an approaching storm.
